comments.author: guillaume.demesy@gmail.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

I juste left the homepage of web interface of freebox revolution open. 


Actual results:

After 5 hours, firefox take 1.5 Go of ram (with 4 tabs: twitter, google +, gmail) , and when I try to change the page of this web interface, firefox doesn't response and craches after  30 seconds.

The crash report : https://crash-stats.mozilla.com/report/index/bp-ff00758a-2137-4438-b5aa-c9b4b2111006


Expected results:

I think it's the cgi script of the chart which takes lof of memory and craches firefox. Because if l left this web app on another page, there is no trouble...
comments.creator: guillaume.demesy@gmail.com

Actual results:

comments.author: guillaume.demesy@gmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 565443
hompage of freebox revolution
comments.creator: guillaume.demesy@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Can you please copy+paste the contents of about:memory into a textfile and attach it here after for example running FF 2h on that page ?

The crash report doesn't contain a stack but it probably a OOM crash and there is no public testcase. This will make this very difficult.
Does it make a difference if you test without addons -> http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode ?
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
